title: craigdonny
author: craigdonny
content: Hi, Had 6 miners working fine for 6 months, last night 4 went off and couldnt connect to internet, also wasent showing on router. Ive now got 5 showing in the router, but only 2 i can log into. The other 3 have IP's but it wont connect to them nor will they connect to the pool. And the 6th i cant get to connect to anything. Reset router, replaced ethernet switch. Any ideas? Cheers

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Have you tried to run them one by one to test if it's an IP issue or not?Have you also set all miners in static instead of DHCP mode?Also, would you mind to tell us the exact unit model of these miners?And pool where you mine?

comments.author: DaCryptoRaccoon
comments.body: Quote from: craigdonny on September 19, 2023, 10:32:29 AMHi, Had 6 miners working fine for 6 months, last night 4 went off and couldnt connect to internet, also wasent showing on router. Ive now got 5 showing in the router, but only 2 i can log into. The other 3 have IP's but it wont connect to them nor will they connect to the pool. And the 6th i cant get to connect to anything. Reset router, replaced ethernet switch. Any ideas? CheersYou could try a hard reset on them or a firmware flash if you are unable to get to the webdash. If you can post the models of the miners will be able to give more advice on how to go about this process.

comments.author: craigdonny
comments.body: Hi thanks for your replies. I have 3 x 120th s19, 2 x 110th s19, and 1 100th s19 pro. I have tested one by one but same results, the same two will come online but none of the others. I haven't turned of DCHP mode. I mine to Luxor pool I did a reset on two that weren't connecting by holding down the reset button but nothing changed. I can see them through the router for about 5 mins after plugging them in, but their ip addresses don't load, and then they just disappear Thanks again for any advice you can give

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: So the 4 units are still unable to access the dashboard even you run them one by one.I'd like you to try to flash the unit through SD card flashing.If you don't know how to flash it through SD card check this guide below.- https://support.bitmain.com/hc/en-us/articles/900003100743-S19-S19-Pro-control-board-program-recovery-SD-card-flashing-

comments.author: craigdonny
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on September 19, 2023, 01:10:02 PMSo the 4 units are still unable to access the dashboard even you run them one by one.I'd like you to try to flash the unit through SD card flashing.If you don't know how to flash it through SD card check this guide below.- https://support.bitmain.com/hc/en-us/articles/900003100743-S19-S19-Pro-control-board-program-recovery-SD-card-flashing-I'll give it a go but I think only 1 has a sd card slot. The other 3 don't have oneWould turning DCHP help and reset everything?

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: craigdonny on September 19, 2023, 02:05:40 PMI'll give it a go but I think only 1 has a sd card slot. The other 3 don't have oneWould turning DCHP help and reset everything? If the other 3 units do not have an SD card slot but there is a Micro/ OTG USB slot you will need a USB adapter or USB port to USB female connector to be able to flash the SD firmware to these miners that do not have SD card slot.Check this guide below for non-SD card slot units.- https://www.zeusbtc.com/articles/asic-miner-troubleshooting/1187-s19j-s19j-pro-control-board-program-recovery

comments.author: craigdonny
comments.body: So im going to do the one with a SD card slot first, but its got a BeagleBone board as i was running Braiins. So unsure which i download for the s19 pro 100th, i assume its "sd-recover-bmu-S19Pro-fixed-202006012027-release.zip    26.91MB    SD firmware for S19 Pro"Could you confirm please?

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Do you have 2 routers between ASICs and the Internet or 1 router?If there are 2 routers, then try to first check each ASIC and connect to the Internet through the first router.Do not rush to update the firmware until you have checked your routers.

comments.author: mikeywith
comments.body: So the miners have been working fine for 6 months, and you did not make any change in the network setup, how come nobody suspected a virus in this story? out of all the possible scenarios out there, the best thing that matches your story would be "your miners got infected with a virus".Do you use the default password on all miners? did you buy any of them used?I mean, if you have not updated your router firmware or added an extra router / managed switch or any change of that nature, it's most likely a virus, you are going to need to Sdcard all of them (or do the equivalent for those CB without Sdcard slot), then you need to find out where did the virus come from? isolate the network, and don't use the old pc/laptop you used to access them.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: craigdonny on September 19, 2023, 11:31:32 PMSo im going to do the one with a SD card slot first, but its got a BeagleBone board as i was running Braiins. So unsure which i download for the s19 pro 100th, i assume its "sd-recover-bmu-S19Pro-fixed-202006012027-release.zip    26.91MB    SD firmware for S19 Pro"Could you confirm please?If it's a beaglebone control board would you mind to check carefully the name of the controller?It seems Bitmain does not have firmware for the s19/pro BB control board if the controller name is S19J_IO_BOARD_V2_0 then you will need the BB firmware from s19j as suggested from Bitmain check the link below.Source: https://support.bitmain.com/hc/en-us/community/posts/16365475069209-I-need-flash-file-for-bitmain-s19-pro-96th-s-with-Ctrl-board-IO-BB
